title: EV maker Lucid announces $3 billion raise from Saudi public wealth fund and stock offering
description: Lucid is raising $3 billion via a secondary stock offering, including about $1.8 billion from the Saudi fund that controls the automaker.

title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon says other bank exec could have booted Jeffrey Epstein as customer
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon answered questions for lawsuits accusing the bank of enabling and benefiting from sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Salesforce bumps up full-year forecast but reports higher capital expenses than expected
description: Salesforce raised its full-year guidance and reported an earnings and revenue beat, but capital costs were higher than expected.

title: JPMorgan rejects claim that Dimon and Staley discussed Epstein: 'We believe this is false'
description: JPMorgan Chase is fighting two lawsuits accusing the bank of enabling and benefiting from Jeffrey Epstein's sex trafficking of young women.

title: OpenAI is pursuing a new way to fight A.I. 'hallucinations'
description: AI hallucinations occur when models like OpenAI's ChatGPT or Google's Bard fabricate information entirely.

title: 'The Little Mermaid's' box office will say a lot about Disney's live-action remake strategy
description: Disney's live-action remake of "The Little Mermaid" had a solid opening weekend, but the film's longevity at the box office will depend on word of mouth.

title: Amazon's Ring to pay FTC $5.8 million over privacy violations
description: Amazon's Ring doorbell unit will pay the Federal Trade Commission $5.8 million in a settlement over privacy violations.

title: Delta Air Lines hit with proposed class action over carbon neutral claims
description: The lawsuit comes three years after Delta announced it would go fully carbon neutral, which means it would cancel out all the emissions it produces.

title: China's Oppo debuts 'mixed reality' headset as Apple, Microsoft explore similar devices
description: Oppo joins companies including Microsoft and Apple in exploring mixed reality and augmented reality headsets.

title: These home improvement projects pay off most — major kitchen and bath remodelings don't make the cut
description: The top home projects promising the greatest returns in resale value are not the ones you would expect.

title: Air New Zealand to ask passengers to weigh themselves before boarding international flights
description: Air New Zealand will start asking passengers to weigh themselves before boarding flights in a survey of more than 10,000 customers.

title: Biden, McCarthy work to shore up support for debt ceiling bill ahead of House vote
description: Leaders of both parties are working to tamp down opposition to the debt ceiling bill, which is expected to get a vote in the full House Wednesday.

title: Amazon workers plan to walk out over 'lack of trust' in leadership
description: Employees are walking out to highlight a "lack of trust in company leadership's decision making," the group said.

title: Not just shoplifting: Here's why companies say retail theft is such a big deal
description: Shrink, retail theft and organized retail theft are often cited by retailers as a reason for lower profits, but the terms are distinctly different.

title: ECB's de Guindos warns financial markets are vulnerable to a sharp sell-off
description: The European Central Bank's May Financial Stability Review warned that the euro area's stability outlook remains fragile.

title: World's biggest investment fund says firms mismanaging climate risk could face exclusion from next year
description: It comes amid a sense of palpable frustration among climate activists during the proxy voting season.

title: British digital bank Monzo hits monthly profitability for the first time after spike in lending
description: Monzo's bump in revenues was driven by a spike in lending activity, with net interest income increasing 382% to £164.2 million.

title: Dimon calls for Washington-Beijing engagement in first China visit since 2021 controversy
description: JPMorgan Chase & Co CEO Jamie Dimon on Wednesday called for "real engagement" between policymakers in Washington and Beijing.

title: Elon Musk’s visit underscores China's importance to global EV market, analysts say
description: Elon Musk's visit to Beijing is spotlighting China's place in the global electric vehicle markets.

title: Hong Kong stocks enter bear market territory as China reopening optimism continues to fade
description: The Hang Seng index is 20% below its recent peak  – a stark contrast to the reopening optimism that had once driven Asia-Pacific's benchmark index to a bull market.

title: A.I. poses human extinction risk on par with nuclear war, Sam Altman and other tech leaders warn
description: "Mitigating the risk of extinction from AI should be a global priority alongside other societal-scale risks such as pandemics and nuclear war," the statement on Tuesday read.

title: North Korea says its first spy satellite launch ends in failure, crashes into sea
description: North Korea's state media agency said that an "accident" occurred during the launch of a military reconnaissance satellite.

title: U.S. accuses Chinese fighter jet of 'unnecessarily aggressive maneuver' in South China Sea
description: A Chinese J-16 fighter jet cut in front of the nose of a U.S. Air Force RC-135 aircraft on May 26, the U.S. Indo-Pacific Command said in a statement.

title: Very few U.S.-China flights are back despite the end of Covid
description: In contrast, flights between the Middle East and mainland China have picked up significantly.

title: New warning signs emerge for China's property market
description: Data for May show China's massive property sector is still struggling to turn around, despite signs of recovery earlier this year.

title: Japan’s largest brewer sets its sights on China — again
description: Japan's Asahi Group Holdings has plans to dive back into the China market as it looks to revive investments in the world's largest beer market.

title: CNBC Daily Open: The A.I. rally is too narrow
description: There are clear winners in the AI race. Everyone else, however, is a bystander reaping no benefits — and that could have implications for broader markets.
